title: Computer Vision Research Scientist
description:
COMPUTER VISION
COMPUTER VISION RESEARCH SCIENTIST

ObEN’s mission is to enable everyone in the world to create their own Personal AI (PAI), intelligent 3D avatars that look, sound, and behave like the individual user. Secured and authenticated on the Project PAI blockchain, ObEN’s technology creates more productive, more personalized digital interactions. ObEN is a K11, Tencent, Softbank Ventures Korea and HTC Vive X portfolio company, and we work with our strategic investors to expand PAI technology across multiple verticals including hospitality, retail, healthcare, and entertainment.

Working at ObEN means taking on extraordinary transformations every day, in an environment that celebrates and encourages innovation. You’ll be working in small, agile teams (including world class researchers in areas of computer vision, machine learning, NLP, speech, and blockchain). We are blazing new trails in AI and blockchain technology, and we encourage and support publications to top conferences and journals. Learn more about working at ObEN in our blog post.

Job Description:

The Computer Vision team aims to reconstruct 3D virtual avatars that look and move just like you with as few as a single selfie as input. As a Research Scientist of the Computer Vision team, you will be collaborating with a small group of talented researchers and together you will define research problems, perform literature review, implement research prototypes, and work closely with research engineers to transform research prototypes into production. We expect you to be able to think out of the box, propose interesting research directions, and provide novel solutions for them. We value researchers who enjoy a highly collaborative environment with minimal supervision.

Responsibilities:
Literature review and discussion with peer researchers to define clear research problems and propose novel solutions
Fast implementation of research ideas into research prototypes
Work closely with research engineers for production
Write technical papers to top-tier conferences such as CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, SIGGRAPH, and SIGGRAPH ASIA
Keep current with latest trends and technologies to help future research subjects and anticipate development needs
Requirements:
Ph.D. in Computer Science or any other relevant disciplines with a background in Computer Vision, Computer Graphics, or Machine Learning; M.S. in the same field with 3 years+ research experience in the industry or academia
Top-tier publication records, including but not limited to CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, SIGGRAPH, SIGGRAPH ASIA, NIPS, and ICML
An understanding of 3D multiview geometry, bundle adjustment, and SLAM/visual odometry
General and deep understanding as well as hands-on experience of applying computer vision technologies, especially 3D reconstruction from camera images and depth sensors
Knowledge and experience of applying machine learning and deep learning to real problems in the fields of vision and graphics
Hands-on experience in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Data Science and their frameworks, such as Tensorflow, Pytorch, and Caffe
Ability to quickly adapt to new situations and to learn new technologies
Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with a multicultural team
Pluses:
Experience in 3D face and/or 3D body modeling from images
Projects experience involving any type of facial image processing and analysis
Knowledge of geometry and topology concepts, representations and data structures, such as splines, level sets, surface and volumetric meshes, point clouds, analytical surfaces/solids, functional representations, subdivision surfaces, T-splines, etc.
Unity3D development experience
VR/AR related development experience
Application Requirements:

Introduction to ObEN: https://goo.gl/gxpxwT

Please send the following to careers@oben.com
Detailed resume and/or LinkedIn profile
Links to any research / papers you have been an instrumental part of and are proud of
Cover Letter identifying your five favorite apps on your phone
Any code you are proud of and is public
Name of instructor / adviser, if any along with link to their profile
130 W Union St Pasadena, California 91103

title: Computer Scientist - Mobile Engagement SDK
description:
About the Role:Creative Cloud Product Experience is seeking an experienced mobile developer to contribute to an exciting, high profile effort to change the way new users engage with Adobe’s creative applications. We are crafting a mobile-first platform to drive the user engagement across Adobe all Adobe Creative Cloud applications leveraging Creative Cloud services and the Sensei AI platform. While executing on this far-reaching strategy we are focusing on using analytics to drive rapid iteration and to continuously deliver measurable impact in our customers' engagement with Creative Cloud. By removing \"first mile\" friction for everyone we are cementing Adobe's lead across the creative product landscape and fostering a new generation of loyal customers. This initiative is a great opportunity to develop shared technology stack serving the flagships of Adobe Creative Cloud as well as cutting-edge next generation applications and products.What are we looking for in an ideal developer? You will be joining a newly formed team of iOS, Android and web front end JS engineers working closely with the internal product team and data scientists. You invite constructive debate, naturally strive to be a mentor and always work with bias towards action. You will design the system to gather analytics data collected across many apps and services, and use machine learning based techniques to infer the likely user intent. We expect you to be passionate about AI and have practical experience with productized ML solutions. Your work will be grounded on the user's engagement, validated in experimentation and pushing the boundaries of integrated learn experience. Most importantly you enjoy taking on complex problems, have a deep empathy for customers, and drive tangible results in a team oriented culture.What you’ll do:
Architect and implement growth components to be delivered as Engagement SDK
Enable growth strategies for millions of users across some of the most powerful creative applications
Develop expertise in writing highly performant native code on iOS and Android.
Engage with product teams across Adobe seeking to understand their requirements and proposing shared solutions
Collect and interpret analytics to continuously increase our impact
Derive ML based solutions to infer user intent and goals
Influence Cloud services to support our team goals
Participate in defining team culture and product vision
What you’ll need to be successful:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field (Master's Degree preferred)
Strong computer science fundamentals
4+ years of development experience with Android or iOS
In-depth knowledge of native code (Objective-C, Android Java, Kotlin) for mobile platforms.
Passion for collaborating with multiple engineering teams that are clients using your software
Excellent communication skills and ability to create consensus among multiple partners
Focus on data driven decision-making and learning by experimentation
Ability to contribute anywhere in the stack and wear different hats
Intellectual curiosity with a keen interest in emerging technologies
A commitment to quality with proven record of maintaining your own unit and integration tests
At Adobe, you will be immersed in a special work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.If you’re looking to grow your career, Adobe’s the place for you.Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

title: Leanpath Summer Intern Java Backend and Machine Vision
description:
Beaverton-based food waste solutions company Leanpath is seeking summer interns to help explore how machine learning/vision can help in solving avoidable food waste.

Can Machine Learning Fight Food Waste?

We sure think it can! We have over 5 years of image-based training data from our 1000s of deployments to prove it with. Our software development team is looking for one or two passionate, talented and inventive programmers and data scientists that will help build the industry-leading item recognition solutions.

Why Intern @ Leanpath?

Our summer internship program runs for 10 to 12 weeks, but were flexible on the start and end dates based on availability. As we only have limited spots available, we accept applications until we find the right candidates. Youll be paired with Principal and Senior developers who manage our current item recognition pipelines and working alongside the entire dev team here at Leanpath. Although the core focus is in the area of item recognition, there are opportunities to apply your skills all parts of the work we do while youre here with us.

About Leanpath

We have a vibrant, mission-based culture that permeates how we approach our work every day. Our dev team is a home for tinkers and life-long learnings. If we dont know it, we figure it out, and then share those learnings amongst our tightly-knit set of coworkers. We have 15 years of food waste prevention experience as a company, but our tech stack is new and were constantly evolving. Its the kind of place where if you have a good idea, you can see it in Production in days, not months. We strive to eliminate inefficiency and red-tape (makes sense as a sustainability company) so you are really only limited by your own enthusiasm for getting things done!

Your Responsibilities
Utilize your knowledge to develop novel models and validation techniques for food item recognition
Aid in the creation of retrieval and processing pipelines for large training data sets
Create internal and customer facing tools for the creation and management of critical meta-data to aid in your model training
Fully participate in all aspects of the software development life-cycle, including all team meetings, planning, and events.
What do we need from you?
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program focused on Computer Science, Data Analytics, Machine Vision, AI, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Science or related degree program
Candidates who have completed their degree in the last six months are also encouraged to apply
Demonstrable experience in the area of machine vision or item recognition
Ability to develop prototypes by manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from various sources
Proficiency in open-source machine learning toolkits such as TensorFlow
Eager to learn new algorithms, new application areas, and new tools
Excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively interface and communicate with a broad array of internal and external contacts including leadership
Practical ability to visualize data, communicate about data, and utilize data effectively
Proficiency in SQL relational databases and/or NoSQL databases
Ability to think creatively and to work well both as part of a team and as an individual contributor
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills
Strong programming skills in at least one object oriented programming language, e.g., Java, Python, C++, Scala, etc.
Required minimum cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.0
Where is the work located?

All work will take place on-site at Leanpath's headquarters in Beaverton, Oregon. have some work-from-home flexibility, but we try to be in the office whenever possible since this is where the magic happens (and more importantly, its where all the other devs are).

title: Data Scientist
description:
Cinteot is looking for a Data Scientist to join our team in McLean, VA. Serves as the Project Technical Lead, ensuring all aspects of the Agile and supporting Teams efforts result in an extensible solution that effectively meets the needs of the Data Scientists and others who use the system. Serves as a primary, customer-facing point-of-contact for all technical aspects of the solution being implemented.

Roles and Responsibilities
Design data science solutions; present approach and results; and interface with customers
Help inform the development of architecture and implementation of a large scale data analytics project
Support the design of predictive analytics models using data analytics and machine learning techniques
Support the design and development of predictive analytics models through the implementation, validation and acceptance of the developed models
Support the evaluation of existing data and analytics capabilities

Basic Qualifications:
Must possess an active Secret security clearance
Bachelor's degree and at least 15 years’ experience
Demonstrated ability programming in Python, R, and/or Scala
Experience using leading data science and machine learning platforms in the industry
Experience developing data analytics and machine learning algorithms, and performing statistical analysis

This position requires the selected candidate to be a US Citizen.

Must possess active Secret security clearance in order to qualify.

Desired Skills:
Bachelor's, Master's or PhD degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Physics or a related field (Computer Sciences)
Experience working within notebook environments such as Jupyter or Zeppelin
Experience creating data analytics visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Tableau or R Shiny
Experience in cloud based environments
Agile development experience on data analytics projects

Benefits:
Complete insurance coverage – Blue Cross Medical, Delta Dental, Vision, Life
401(K) with company contribution
Generous paid time off
Cinteot is an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

title: Data Scientist / Senior Data Scientist
description:
Pipefy is currently searching for an analytically strong, technically proficient and startup-ready professional to be our first-ever Data Science hire. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work within product development and other cross-functional teams for the analysis of products and experiments that deliver against the company’s vision and strategy. Reporting directly to the VP of Product Development, this is an excellent opportunity to grow with a scaling startup, as well as drive the scope of your role and career trajectory within the high-growth data-science community.

As Senior Data Scientist, your main responsibilities include working cross-functionally to analyze business priorities, build the story and the case for product improvements, greater experimentation, and higher ROI, and working with engineering, design and other cross-functional teams for analysis of product lines and features. To be successful in this role, you should have a passion for solving problems and growing business understanding through data.

What you´ll do:
Collaborate with leadership, product development, and customer-facing functions to prioritize, develop and act on product data analyses and experimental hypotheses.
Own the data environment for the company that enables us to run experiments and act on data we collect, as well as collaborate with engineering to ensure that the environment evolves with our needs and scale.
Partner to drive the case for vendors, partners and implementation methods (e.g. tech stack, tools, core competencies, machine learning strategies) in our data environment, teams and related workflows.
Gain a deep understanding of the Pipefy lean management platform and its myriad use cases through data as well as interactions with customer-users and internal stakeholders.
Adopt a data-driven approach to analyze the implementation of features for business and customer impact.
Develop predictive models of customer expansion and churn and partner with customer-facing teams to integrate them into workflows, refine practices and messaging accordingly.
Analyze behavioral analytics to support experimentation and campaign optimization.
What we need you to have:

At least 4 years work experience in a Data Science or Analytics function.
Ability to analyze, troubleshoot, problem solve, and present data for cross-functional action.
Experience making data-driven decisions and recommendations to a senior group.
Demonstrated examples of implementing data pipelines and related workflows.
Expert-level SQL and data-visualization/management tool familiarity.
Near-expert data-oriented programming languages (Python or R) -- but don’t worry you will have Engineering support for production-quality implementations.
Basic familiarity with AWS cloud computes and storage architectures.
Good storytelling and aptitude for data visualization.
Collaborative skills, including comfort with distributed teams.
Bachelor's degree required.
You should be in the EU/US timezone.
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and with customers -- your application submission and resume / CV should be in English.
It would be awesome if you have:
A Mathematical or Computer Science concentration or you have a degree in a related field (we are more interested in your professional work).
A Familiarity with enterprise IT, SaaS, systems integration and/or cloud technologies a plus (engineering experience is not required).
A Client-facing experience in consulting capacities.
A San Francisco location (if remote, must be willing to travel occasionally).
Benefits:

Competitive Health, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance benefits.
Gym membership credit.
Fully-stocked kitchen, subsidized team lunches.
Off-hours Uber/Lyft.
Pipefy: The Lean Management Platform – Meet Us:

Lean management principles have proven to be transformative–but only for people with access to extensive training and resources. Pipefy changes that, with the first lean management platform. We believe that when doers have the tools they need to improve their work, without relying on anyone else, there’s no limit to what they can accomplish.

We make it easy to for anyone to streamline recurring business processes on their own, from employee onboarding to customer service to agile development. Our customizable, template-driven software helps people eliminate wasted time and effort and become more agile and efficient

title: Junior Computer Vision Engineer
description:
Applied Research Associates, Inc. (ARA) is actively seeking a qualified Computer Vision Engineer for the development of advanced algorithms for the intelligence and defense communities. Application areas include geolocation, image analysis, machine learning, and point cloud analysis. The scientist / engineer will join a multi-disciplined collaborative team of engineers and scientists

If you want to accelerate your career growth and are passionate about applying your expertise to solve problems of national importance then we have the job you are looking for! You will be able to achieve your personal and professional goals in a stable environment that emphasizes and rewards the entrepreneurial spirit.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate will have an active interest in applying math/statistics/physics/engineering concepts to solve multi-disciplinary problems. The candidate should be familiar with improving/optimizing/tuning existing algorithms as well as development of new algorithms from scratch. This will include software design, software development, and debugging / issue resolution. The candidate should demonstrate a hands-on approach to problem solving and must be willing to actively participate in evaluation of algorithm and system performance. Other responsibilities include assisting in preparation of oral and written reports, supporting R&D business acquisition.

Scientists / engineers who are passionate about applying their expertise to solve problems of national importance, who have a strong entrepreneurial spirit, and who are seeking opportunities for personal and professional growth in a stable environment are strongly encouraged to apply.

Required Computer Vision Engineer Qualifications:
BS in Mathematics / Physics / Engineering / Computer Science along with 1-2 years' experience
Strong foundation in software development and experience with designing computer vision algorithms
Drive to address complex problems with technical solutions that work
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment
Desire to work in a highly collaborative, innovative, small R&D team
Strong initiative, self-starter, quick-learner, proactive contributor
Excellent presentation and written / oral communication skills
US Citizenship (Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information)
Additional Desirable Qualifications:
MS. or Ph.D. in Mathematics / Physics / Engineering / Computer Science or a related quantitative field
Software development experience with a high-level language such as Java or modern C++
Familiarity with software design patterns
Experience prototyping algorithms in Python using libraries such as Numpy, TensorFlow, OpenCV, Pandas, scikit-image
Proficiency in some of the following areas: statistics, optimization, photogrammetry, machine learning, image analysis, signal processing
Experience with geospatial data formats, concepts, and tools such as GeoTIFFs, coordinate reference systems, GIS, GDAL
Experience working with LiDAR and/or photogrammetric point clouds
Experience with cloud-based computing
Experience working on intelligence and DoD programs
Prior / existing security clearance
COMPANY INFORMATION:

Applied Research Associates, Inc. is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. The company, founded in Albuquerque, NM, in 1979, currently employs over 1,100 professionals and continues to grow. ARA offices throughout the United States and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense technologies, civil technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. The corporation also provides sophisticated technical products for environmental site characterization, pavement analysis, and robotics.

While this is all of the Year One and Beyond stuff, Day One is pretty good too. These are things like our competitive salary (DOE), Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), benefits package, and a challenging culture where innovation& experimentation are the norm. At ARA, employees are our greatest assets. The corporation realizes that employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels. ARA gives its employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take more active roles as owners. The motto,“Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please apply at careers.ara.com.

Requirements
Relevant Work Experience

title: -Computer Vision Research Scientist
description:
Are you a computer vision enthusiast who wants to develop cutting-edge algorithms and see them actually work and be used? Do you want to make a positive impact on the lives of billions of people? Alibaba invites you to join our brand-new AutoNavi research team, tasked for exploring and developing technologies to create a new future for mapping and navigation, examples including large-scale traffic estimation and simulation, real-time video analysis, localization, high-definition maps and assisted driving, as well as AR navigation and infotainment. If you are an independent problem solver, have a strong drive to excel, with enormous passion in internet industry, and are looking for opportunities to make a big impact, this is the right place for you. We have offices in Beijing, Hangzhou, Seattle and Bay Area. All levels of experience and all subareas of expertise are welcome.

- Ph.D. in computer science or related fields (or 5+ years of equivalent research experience)
Expertise and knowledge in the state of the art of computer vision and machine learning
Proven track record of coming up with novel ideas and developing novel solutions
Hands-on and motivated to build things and make them work
Strong communication skills and ability to work with partners both in China and USA
At Alibaba, we dont just provide a job opportunity we aim to help our employees to find their best selves.

title: Data Scientist
description:
TKXS Data Scientist

Can you tell a story with data? Do you have a gift for applying machine-learning to solve business problems? Are you a data scientist who can think outside-the-box when drilling into a problem, but then bring it back home and make it easy-to-understand even for executives and sales and marketing types?

Most important, are you seeking a workplace where talents as specialized as yours are appreciated? Where you can make a genuine difference in company growth and direction?

If so, we'd like to talk to you. We're TKXS, a leading provider of technology and data-driven services in agriculture, healthcare and B2B verticals. We're currently seeking a data scientist to join our fast-growing Data Science Practice.

About TKXS

Our clients know us to be trustworthy, responsive and straightforward, and while we count myriad strengths, TKXS' greatest advantage is our team. Guided by five core values rather than overly rigorous policies, we're able to trust more and achieve more. We team up, stay curious, take responsibility, speak out, and serve others. Grounded by thoughtful planning, and fueled by innovative teammates, your future at TKXS could be bright indeed.

What We're Seeking
Someone to work closely with clients and other data scientists to solve business problems by identifying opportunities to apply machine learning and statistical methods
Someone to work on the end to end data science process, including collection, feature identification, modeling, testing and deployment
Someone who can communicate to stakeholders the importance of their analysis
Someone who can juggle multiple priorities while collaborating with other team members to keep the business moving forward
About the Position

As a Data Scientist at TKXS, you will work with other data scientists and data analysts in our Charlotte and Raleigh offices to build meaningful and elegant solutions to business problems using machine learning, statistical modeling, and Tableau visualizations. You will help our clients better understand their businesses by identifying problems that can be solved using these higher order mathematical techniques. You will deliver finalized products to our customers in a clear and easy-to-understand fashion.

Credentials

The successful candidate should have at least two years of professional experience working with cross-functional teams. We'd also prefer that you have:
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, or related field, with Master's degree a plus
At least two years of professional experience in data science, data analytics or similar job type
Solid experience in both the theory and application of machine learning algorithms
Intermediate knowledge in statistical programming languages such as R and Python
Intermediate knowledge in relational databases such as SQL Server
Intermediate knowledge in visualization software such as Tableau a plus
Why TKXS?

At TKXS, you'll be positioned to do your best work ever, surrounded by caring, fun-loving and inspiring teammates. We work hard for our clients, but we play hard, too. Think happy hours, abundant community service opportunities and plenty of impromptu get togethers.

We also provide a hefty benefits package -- health insurance, maternity and paternity leave, prescription drug insurance, pet insurance, a 401(k) matching program, as well as affordable family benefits. TKXS also covers -- 100% -- dental, vision, and life insurance for full-time employees.

And then, there are the perks game rooms, wellness programs, healthy snacks, and adult beverages in the break room, to name just a few.

Ready to bring out the best in yourself? Let us hear from you. Call, send an email, or apply today!

title: Machine Learning and Computer Vision Engineer
description:
Who We Are

Neya is a leader in developing off-road autonomy for both commercial and defense customers, and we are looking for a strong software engineer with experience in machine learning and computer vision to join our team. If you join our team, you will have an opportunity work to solve a diverse set of challenges ranging from the autonomous jet-ski perception, automatic target recognition, 3D scene reconstruction, and autonomous off-road vehicles. You will also work with a strong team of scientists and engineers located in Pittsburgh, Massachusetts, and Colorado to help drive critical architecture decisions in our machine learning and computer vision pipeline.

This position is based in our Warrendale, PA office.

Interested in joining our team? Take a look below to see exactly what we are looking for. If you feel that you meet most but not all of the requirements below, please reach out to us, you might be a good fit.

What You Will Do
Design and optimize implementation of cutting edge ML systems in object classification, labelling, object detection, and/or prediction
Enhance unified back end architecture for solving multiple ML problems
Extract features and other important characteristics from LIDAR data as well as stereo camera systems
Work with other team members (inside and outside of Neya) to provide ROS-compatible datasets for communication within the target architecture
What We Are Looking For
M.S. Robotics, Computer Science, or similar, or equivalent industry experience
5+ years of relevant industry experience
Extensive experience with sensor data processing, environment modeling, large-scale point-cloud processing
Experience with machine learning and classification, filtering, deep learning, segmentation
Excellent mathematical reasoning skills, especially with probability
Comfortable writing high-quality code in Linux/C++11 or C++14
Understanding of sensor error modeling
Passion for developing advanced robotics and intelligent systems
What Makes Neya Unique
Solve immediate and pressing real-world problems that advance state-of-the-art
Work with some of the smartest people in unmanned systems
Great company culture
Competitive salary and benefits including 401k, and company paid medical, dental, life insurance
Flexible hours and working conditions
This position requires use of information that is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and/or the Export Administration Regulations (EAR), Non-U.S. persons selected must meet eligibility requirements for access to export-restricted information. The ITAR/EAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. Green Card Holder), Political Asylee, or Refugee.

title: Sr. Research Scientist, Computer Vision
Senior Human Vision Scientist
description:
Job Description

The Quantified Experience (QX) team is seeking a human vision scientist with extensive prior interdisciplinary scientific experience. The position involves leading end-to-end studies with human participants, including experimental design, data analysis, reporting and stakeholder management. Candidates must be able to creatively apply fundamental knowledge from human vision science.

The QX team informs leadership and other teams on perceptual best practices and works closely with other departments such Systems, Optical Engineering, Health Care, Human Factors and UX/UI teams. We are looking for candidates who are creative, energetic team players who excel in a fast-paced, hands-on environment.

Responsibilities:
Conduct research into human visual perception to inform product decisions.
Be aware of the latest developments in the field of human vision science.
Collaborate with other Magic Leap teams to explore perceptual factors, define engineering and design specifications, and make recommendations to improve visual perception in mixed reality.
Take a research question from hypothesis to delivery using scientific methods. Communicate the results to stakeholders clearly and in a timely manner.
Qualifications:

Extensive experience with psychophysical and other psychological research methods
Profound knowledge of at least one of the following programming languages: Matlab, C/++, Python
Extensive experience with data analysis methods and statistical packages such as R
Experience with modeling human visual perception processes
Experience with Unity or OpenGL is a plus
Experience with Matlab Psychtoolbox is a plus
Knowledge of machine learning techniques is a plus
Excellent communication skills
Interest in latest developments in vision research and curiosity around the future of computing and experience platforms
Education:

PhD and/or post-doctoral experience in human vision science and/or related field with first author journal publications in one or more of the following or related research areas: stereopsis, color vision, visual acuity, low-level visual processing, or multimodal information processing.
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunities guidelines.

title: Software Engineer, Computer Vision Tools
description:
Job Description

Magic Leap is an eclectic group of visionaries, rocket scientists, wizards, and gurus from the fields of film, robotics, visualization, software, computing, and user experience. We are growing quickly, and this is the time to get on board and play a role in shaping the way people will be interacting with the world tomorrow.

The Computer Vision Data team at Magic Leap is responsible for creating large scale datasets for training, building and validating Computer Vision and Machine Learning algorithms. In this role you will work on creating tools for integrating ground truth data sources with Magic Leap sensor data, and on processing collected data to validate it's quality, and extract metadata from it. This role will require working on a variety of platforms: On device, on local machines for integration, and on the cloud for processing at scale. In this role you will work across the computer vision stack, working on tools for head pose, world reconstruction, eye tracking, hand tracking, and more, and be exposed to many of the core technologies at Magic Leap.

Responsibilities:
Design and build tools to record and save sensor data from Magic Leap devices and other XR devices
Design and implement tools for integration with ground truth tools (motion capture, LIDAR, etc.)
Design and develop tools that summarize and visualize data to drive data use in algorithm research and development
Design and develop tools and procedures to find, visualize and improve curated data
Work closely with Vision team members to define requirements and validate tool performance
Qualifications:

3+ years of experience working with Python as a main programming language
Some experience with C++ and web stack development
Experience with Linux OS, docker and cloud platforms
Excellent problem solving, troubleshooting and debugging skills
Familiarity with Unity / Unreal - a plus for on device tools
Familiarity with computer vision / deep learning - a plus
Education:

BS/BE in CS or equivalent.
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunities guidelines.

title: Scientist IV - Machine Learning and Computer Vision
description:
EDUCATION DESIRED: MS or Ph.D. in EE, Computer Science, Applied Math or related fields.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Primary job function is to perform R & D in machine learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, computer vision and other areas. Tasks will include the development, simulation, evaluation, and implementation in software of machine learning and computer vision algorithms applied to a variety of applications. Additional job functions include solving customer problems, writing invention disclosures, publishing papers, briefing customers, and assisting in marketing HRL expertise.

EXPERIENCE DESIRED: Research experience in one or more of the following areas: machine learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning, computer vision, 2D and 3D object recognition. Application of machine learning and computer vision techniques to object detection, object recognition, image/video captioning, activity recognition, problem solving, situation assessment, perception error recovery and decision making for autonomous systems. Experience developing innovative solutions based upon the application of relevant research results from a wide variety of sources. Familiarity with C, C++, Python, JAVA, OpenCV, PCL, and/or Matlab/Simulink. Experience in using machine learning tools and packages (e.g., Caffe, Torch, TensorFlow).

KNOWLEDGE DESIRED: Expertise in Deep Learning, Convolutional Neural Networks, Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), Long short-term memory (LSTM) neural networks, recurrent neural networks and reinforcement learning. Expertise in computer vision, 2D or 3D object recognition, activity recognition, scene understanding and knowledge-based perception.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: U.S. citizenship or permanent resident status required.

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

title: Intern- Computer Vision Engineering
description:
Light up Life.

At Leia we are working at the forefront of display technology making screens come to life in richer, deeper, and more beautiful ways. We apply our proprietary nanotechnology to give any display the ability to produce light field, immersive "holographic" content no glasses, no tracking, no fuss.

Through our digital platform LeiaLoft, we also aim to create an environment where developers and artists of the future will bring their creativity to life and deliver breathtaking experiences to the world at large.

Come join a team of passionate scientists, engineers and artists in a beautiful adventure where you will be defining the digital experiences of tomorrow.

Responsibilities

As a computer vision intern at Leia, you will explore a project that marries cutting edge computer vision or deep learning with Leia's light-field display technology. Under the mentorship of a senior computer vision engineer, some of the problems you might work on include:
Disparity estimation
Depth from single image
Stereo super-resolution
Inverse rendering
Multiview lighting effects
Photorealistic style transfer
Requirements
Proficiency in Python.
A good understanding of the fundamentals and best practices of deep learning.
Familiarity with CNN architectures such as ResNet, VGG, UNet, Stacked Hourglass, MobileNet, pix2pix, and CycleGAN.
Proficiency with a deep learning framework such as Pytorch, TensorFlow, Caffe, or Theano.
Experience with Computer Vision algorithms and techniques.
Experience with OpenCV.
Bonus
Proficiency with Java and/or C++.
Experience with data cleaning, analysis, and developing efficient, accurate data annotation schemes.
Experience with commercial software development processes: good software hygiene regarding code documentation, unit testing, bug tracking, and version control.
Highly motivated, team player with strong technical collaboration skills and desire to learn quickly and develop new skills.
The desire to be part of a fast-moving start-up and work in a collaborative environment with few rigid boundaries.
GPU programming experience.
Passion for photography or art.
#LI-EL1

title: Research Scientist for Computer Vision / Machine Learning
description:
We are seeking extraordinary hardware and architecture researchers to contribute to the development of future state of the art high-performance and mobile computing systems, with an emphasis on architectures for computer vision & machine learning algorithms. We are looking for candidates that have a consistent track record of research excellence; systems-building experience; a broad perspective across the field of computer architecture; and depth in data parallel architectures and computer vision or machine learning. We have pioneered programmable GPUs and the CUDA language, and is a world leader in high-performance and mobile computing technology, with aggressive plans for future processors. This position offers the opportunity to have a real impact in a dynamic, technology-focused company.

What you’ll be doing:

· You’ll develop creative architectures to address the emerging demands of computer vision and machine learning algorithms.

· Understand and analyze the interplay between hardware, software, and media processing algorithms.

· Collaborate with a diverse set of teams across the company, spanning software, research, engineering, and product groups.

· Publish original research and speak at conferences and events.

What we need to see:

· Ph.D. in CE/CS/EE with a strong background in computer architecture, VLSI, parallel processing, and/or HPC. A strong publication, patent and research collaboration history is a huge advantage.

· Expertise in computer vision or machine learning algorithms.

· Experience with experimental computer architecture development and evaluation.

· Experience with C, C++, and scripting languages.

· Strong communication skills needed. Being a creative and dynamic presenter is a big advantage.

title: Research Scientist, Mobile Computer Vision
description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.We are seeking world-class computer vision experts to join our teams in developing next generation products and platforms doing research and engineering at scale.
Our mission is to advance the state of the art in computer vision algorithms for mobile and embedded vision. The person in this role will be working on Facebook's largest scale mobile computer vision algorithms and models which are leveraged by product development teams throughout the company. Our research is critical to delivering new computer vision based mobile applications to our 2 billion+ users.

Responsibilities:
Doing research for novel and accurate deep learning algorithms in computer vision
Collaborate with team members from the research to the level of production
Mininum Qualifications:
PhD with experience in Computer Science with published projects in the fields of deep learning and computer vision in conferences
Experience in theoretical and empirical research and for answering questions with research
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with model optimization for mobile/embedded platforms

title: Computer Vision Research Engineer
description:
COMPUTER VISION
COMPUTER VISION RESEARCH ENGINEER

ObEN’s mission is to enable everyone in the world to create their own Personal AI (PAI), intelligent 3D avatars that look, sound, and behave like the individual user. Secured and authenticated on the Project PAI blockchain, ObEN’s technology creates more productive, more personalized digital interactions. ObEN is a K11, Tencent, Softbank Ventures Korea and HTC Vive X portfolio company, and we work with our strategic investors to expand PAI technology across multiple verticals including hospitality, retail, healthcare, and entertainment.

Working at ObEN means taking on extraordinary transformations every day, in an environment that celebrates and encourages innovation. You’ll be working in small, agile teams (including world class researchers in areas of computer vision, machine learning, NLP, speech, and blockchain). We are blazing new trails in AI and blockchain technology, and we encourage and support publications to top conferences and journals. Learn more about working at ObEN in our blog post.

Job Description:

The Computer Vision team aims to reconstruct 3D virtual avatars that look and move just like you with as few as a single selfie as input. As a Research Engineer of the Computer Vision team, you will be closely working with researcher scientists, back-end engineers and front-end engineers to transform and deploy research prototypes into production. We value engineers who are self-motivated and enjoy a highly collaborative environment with minimal supervision.

Responsibilities:
Develop impactful and innovative computer vision technologies
Work closely with research scientists to deeply understand the developed research prototypes and transform them into production
Work closely with front-end and back-end engineers for production integration
Evaluate the technical trade-offs of every decision
Write production code that will be used by millions of users
Introduce major innovations that can lead to novel product features
Keep current with latest trends and technologies to help future research subjects and anticipate development needs
Requirements:
M.S. in Computer Science with project experience in the fields of Computer Vision, Computer Graphics, or Machine Learning; B.S. in the same field with 3 years+ working experience in the industry
Outstanding programming skills in C++ and/or C#
Comfortable with programming in Python and/or MATLAB
Strong algorithmic and code-level optimization skills
An understanding of 3D multiview geometry, bundle adjustment, and SLAM/visual odometry
General understanding of computer vision, especially 3D reconstruction from camera images and depth sensors
Knowledge and hands-on experience of applying machine learning and deep learning to real problems in the fields of vision and graphics
Ability to quickly adapt to new situations and to learn new technologies
Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with a multicultural team
Pluses:
Ph.D. in Computer Science with project experience in the fields of Computer Vision, Computer Graphics, or Machine Learning
Experience in 3D face and/or 3D body modeling from images
Projects experience involving any type of facial image processing and analysis
Knowledge of geometry and topology concepts, representations and data structures, such as splines, level sets, surface and volumetric meshes, point clouds, analytical surfaces/solids, functional representations, subdivision surfaces, T-splines, etc.
Unity3D development experience
VR/AR related development experience
Application Requirements:

Introduction to ObEN: https://goo.gl/gxpxwT

Please send the following to careers@oben.com
Detailed resume and/or LinkedIn profile
Links to any research / papers you have been an instrumental part of and are proud of
Cover Letter identifying your five favorite apps on your phone
Any code you are proud of and is public
Name of instructor / adviser, if any along with link to their profile
130 W Union St Pasadena, California 91103

title: Computer Vision Platform Engineer
description:
What You'll Do:
Contribute to all aspects of the sports vision platform and services under the team’s ownership, which includes design, implementation, refactoring, automated testing, deployment, and uptime of the services.
Work closely with data scientist on deep learning and video processing-based AI models.
Improve internal team processes by keeping what's working and throwing away what's not
Collaborate on the vision of the services under the team's ownership

Bachelor’s or Post-graduate degree in Computer Science or related experience

title: Data Scientist
description:
Do you have a passion for all things data? Are you ready to create next-generation data science to power a company reshaping an industry? Do you want to disrupt the 20-billion dollar ticketing industry with innovative technology?

If so, we would love to hear from you! Experience, expapp.com, is seeking an experienced Data Scientist to join our rapidly-growing team to help take us to the next level of awesome.

Please note, this role is not scheduled to be hired until October 1, 2019.

In this exciting role, you will:
Create predictive models to power innovative ticketing products
Acquire and explore data from creative sources to power data science initiatives
Create data pipelines and applications in Amazon Web Services environments
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies

Pennant of your university hung with pride in the office

description:
Charles River Analytics is searching for a software engineer who shares our passion for innovative research, cutting-edge technology, and solving real-world challenges through the development of next-generation computer vision systems.

Computer vision/image processing
Mobile/web applications

You will work with a multi-disciplinary team of developers, scientists, and subject matter experts across government, industry and academia on computer vision applications designed for mobile and edge computing devices. Since our focus is to create novel, game-changing technologies, the ideal candidate will thrive in the face of changing or loosely-defined requirements. WebGL
Python

title: Research Scientist - Computer Vision, Deep Learning, Perception
description:
Division: Corporate Technology
Business Unit: Research in Digitalization and Automation
Requisition Number: 220747
Primary Location: United States-New Jersey-Princeton
Assignment Category: Full-time regular
Experience Level: Entry level
Education Required Level: Doctorate Degree
Travel Required: 5%

Division Description:
For nearly 170 years, pioneering technologies and the business models developed from them have been the foundation of Siemens‘ success. Our central research and development unit, Corporate Technology (CT) plays an important role in this. Together with our global network of experts, we are a strategic partner to Siemens’ operative units and provide important services along the entire value chain – from research and development to production and quality assurance, as well as optimized business processes. Our support provided to the businesses in their research and development activities is ideally balanced with our own future-oriented research.

We at Corporate Technology are more than employees: We are actively helping to make people’s lives a little better every day. Would you like to be a part of that? Then join us. We offer you a high level of practical relevance as well as an opportunity to individually contribute your knowledge and your visions around the world. Whether you’re helping to develop products for the operating units or working in interdisciplinary projects for the business areas: At Corporate Technology you’ll be working in the heart of Siemens’ technological research together with the best.

Job Description:
The Vision Technology and Solutions group within Siemens Corporate Technology has an immediate opening in Princeton, NJ for a research scientist with a focus on Deep Learning for Computer Vision and Image Analytics. This role is an exciting opportunity to join a newly formed team and contribute to its future growth.

Our Princeton facility is recognized for providing a stimulating environment for highly talented and self-motivated researchers. You will have the opportunity to test your knowledge in a challenging problem-solving environment. You will be encouraged to think out-of-the-box, innovate and find solutions to real-life problems. Our team has a strong publication record in leading journals and conferences.

What are my responsibilities?
Research, design, and implement algorithms in Deep Learning for Computer Vision and Image Analytics.
Contribute to research projects that develop a variety of algorithms and systems in computer vision, image and video analysis.
Advance the state-of-the-art in the field, including generating patents and publications in top journals and conferences.
Apply image and video analysis techniques such as deep learning to large-scale, real-world problems.
Fast prototyping, feasibility studies, specification and implementation of image and video analysis product components.
Working with customers to understand algorithm requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.
What do I need to qualify for this job?
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related discipline required. Strong background in Deep Learning.
Min of 3 years of Graduate research and internship experience in Computer Vision, Machine Learning and Image Understanding preferred.
Proven ability to develop new research ideas as demonstrated by a strong publication record and early developments to the level of a working system prototype.
Strong theoretical and practical background in computer vision, image and video analysis, specifically object detection, tracking and recognition, statistical modeling, statistical pattern recognition, machine learning, sparse methods, applied mathematics, optimization.
Hands-on coding skills and ability to quickly prototype in C++ is a must. Further experience in Scripting languages such as Python is a plus.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in English are required.
Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on http://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs?view=category&id=33#

title: Senior Computer Scientist
description:
The challenge

Are you passionate about mobile software development that has a wide ranging impact? Do you thrive on the challenge to be part of a team central to Adobe’s mobile applications future? Do you cherish the opportunity to learn and be part of Adobe’s multi-platform development strategy? If you enthusiastically answered yes to these questions, this is the place for you!

More than ever Adobe is focused on simplifying the workflows for creative professionals. One clear way to take creatives to the next level is to have easy access to the richness of the Adobe Creative Cloud services in a consistent way across the portfolio of Adobe apps, initially mobile, but with the opportunity to extend this functionality across platforms. Come and join the Creative Cloud Experience team to define and develop this vision through the development of shared mobile components to lead creatives into a higher level of productivity.

You’ll join an independent, experienced, professional team dedicated to making this vision true. A team with the maturity to provide guidance, but also open to new ideas and explore new opportunities. Based on the San Francisco Bay Area you’ll be part of a cosmopolitan, diverse environment at the center of the proverbial continued tech revolution.

What you'll do

The ideal candidate will embrace a highly collaborative team that rewards quality code and effective communication. You'll feel comfortable taking calculated risks to change technical direction and can articulate the benefits and costs of a decision. Your core responsibilities will be to:
Use your mobile development experience to create functional and visual components targeting iOS for use in Adobe mobile apps.
Adapt and adopt new technology directions to advance Adobe multi-platform strategy
Be the tech leader for team initiatives setting direction to internal and partner developers
Partner with designers and business leaders to provide a best-in-class customer experience
Engage with partner Adobe organizations to understand problems, test ideas, and refine workflows
Stay current with the latest development best practices and share your findings with the team and community
What you need to succeed
10+ years of software engineering experience, including solid understanding of UI design principles
10+ years experience using object-oriented languages: Objective-C, Swift, and/or C++.
Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals
Familiarity with JavaScript and React a plus
Solid understanding and familiarity in the use of REST APIs
At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

title: Software Development Engineer, Computer Vision
description:
Are you excited about building applications that use computer vision and machine learning to make autonomous decisions? The Visual Bin Inspection(VBI) team is looking for a talented software engineer to be part of the innovation driving counting of items through completely automated as well as computer-human hybrid techniques.
You and your team will own state-of-the-art automation systems for Amazons Fulfillment Centers using computer vision, machine-learning, custom-designed image-processing algorithms. The team collaborates with computer vision research scientists to solve tough problems, develop hardware and software prototypes, building them into large-scale production systems across Amazon's global FC network.
Amazon Fulfillment Technologies (AFT) powers the physical engine at the heart of Amazon. AFT builds and operates software, hardware, and the processes that run the global network of fulfillment centers that move billions of units of inventory, employ tens of thousands of people, and ensure that customers get what they want when promised. We do this by building automated solutions to handle things that technology does well, while relying on people to handle things that humans do well.

As a software development engineer on this team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the design and development of our services, by
· Working with extraordinary talent to drive scalable design
· Designing, implementing, testing, deploying and maintaining innovative software solutions to transform service performance, durability, cost, and security.
· Using software engineering best practices to ensure a high standard of quality for all of the team deliverables
· Writing high quality distributed system software
· Collaborating with Research scientists to enable development of new machine learning models, update and retrain current models
· Working in an agile, startup-like development environment, where you are always focusing on the most important tasks
If you are excited to be working on cutting edge technology and want to get immersed into computer vision and machine learning, youll find this role to be engaging, challenging, and full of opportunities to learn and grow. You will own development and operation of the systems that you develop. If this sounds interesting to you, talk to us!

As a software developer, if you already happen to have a familiarity or passion in machine-learning, image-processing, hardware integration and/or computer vision - you can jump right in!
If you are not familiar with those areas, we'd love to have you and will help you to learn.

Our team was recently featured by CNN :
https://www.cnn.com/2018/10/05/tech/amazon-artificial-intelligence/index.html

Basic Qualifications

· Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field
· Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures & algorithms, problem solving, and complexity analysis
· Knowledge of, at least, one modern programming language such as C, C++, C#, Java, or Perl

title: Research Scientist, Computer Vision (PhD Student or Grad)
description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.Facebook Reality Lab is a world leader in the development of future generations of AR/VR systems. We are currently seeking a Computer Vision Research Scientist in Redmond, WA. The research agenda is focused on advanced sensing that is multi-disciplinary and at the intersection of sensing hardware and software across the stack of sensors, system, computer vision algorithms and applications. The position requires a PhD in electrical engineering, computer science, mathematics or similar field. This is a full-time position based in Redmond, WA.

Responsibilities:
Research and develop future advanced sensing systems
Develop and optimize computer vision and machine learning algorithms for high performance, low-power, low latency implementation
Perform software and hardware co-optimization in a full stack solution
Lead/Support system performance evaluation and benchmarking by modeling, simulation, testing, data collection, and tradeoff study
Collaborate with internal and external research scientists, hardware and software engineers and third party vendors throughout development phases
Mentor MS/PhD interns and collaborate with external academic groups to advance our research goals

Available to start employment on or after January 1, 2019
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a PhD degree or completing a postdoctoral assignment in the field of Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar
Experience in one or more of the following fields: Computer Vision, Computational Photography, Sensor Modeling, Sensor Fusion, State Estimation, 3D Reconstruction, Mapping & Localization, 3D geometry, Physics based models, or a related field
4+ years experience in C++ programming with coding and debugging
Experience with real world system building and data collection, including design, coding (C++) and evaluation (C++/Python)
Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in computational photography algorithm and system development

title: Senior Scientist - Computer Vision, Deep Learning and Perception
description:
Division: Corporate Technology
Business Unit: Research in Digitalization and Automation
Requisition Number: 237668
Primary Location: United States-New Jersey-Princeton
Assignment Category: Full-time regular
Experience Level: Senior level
Education Required Level: Doctorate Degree
Travel Required: 15%

Division Description:
For nearly 170 years, pioneering technologies and the business models developed from them have been the foundation of Siemens‘ success. Our central research and development unit, Corporate Technology (CT) plays an important role in this. Together with our global network of experts, we are a strategic partner to Siemens’ operative units and provide important services along the entire value chain – from research and development to production and quality assurance, as well as optimized business processes. Our support provided to the businesses in their research and development activities is ideally balanced with our own future-oriented research.

We at Corporate Technology are more than employees: We are actively helping to make people’s lives a little better every day. Would you like to be a part of that? Then join us. We offer you a high level of practical relevance as well as an opportunity to individually contribute your knowledge and your visions around the world. Whether you’re helping to develop products for the operating units or working in interdisciplinary projects for the business areas: At Corporate Technology you’ll be working in the heart of Siemens’ technological research together with the best.

Job Description:
The Vision Technologies and Solutions group within Siemens Corporate Technology has an immediate opening in Princeton, NJ for a Senior Research Scientist with a focus on Computer Vision, Deep Learning and Perception. This role is an exciting opportunity to join a newly formed team and contribute to its future growth.

Our Princeton facility is recognized for providing a stimulating environment for highly talented and self-motivated researchers. You will have the opportunity to test your knowledge in a challenging problem-solving environment. You will be encouraged to think out-of-the-box, innovate and find solutions to real-life problems. Our team has a strong publication record in leading journals and conferences such as CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, etc.

What are my responsibilities?
Research, design, and implement algorithms in Deep Learning for Computer Vision and Perception.
Contribute to research projects that develop a variety of algorithms and systems in computer vision, machine learning, and perception.
Develop technology roadmap elements further and propose new technologies to be included in the roadmap.
Advance the state-of-the-art in the field, including generating patents and publications in top journals and conferences.
Apply image and video analysis techniques such as deep learning to large-scale, real-world problems.
Fast prototyping, feasibility studies, specification and implementation of visual perception product components.
Establish internal network to acquire projects and maintain the relationships with customers in Siemens business units.
Collaborating with partners from top tier universities on cutting-edge research problems and securing government research grants in relevant domains.
Working with customers to understand algorithm requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.
Leading and coaching junior colleagues in research and development activities and strengthen the skillset of the team.
Support developing brand recognition of Siemens externally and increasing visibility of the research group by networking with external experts and attending academic conferences.
What do I need to qualify for this job?
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related discipline required. Strong background in Computer Vision and Deep Learning.
Minimum of 6 years of industrial research and development experience in the field of Computer Vision, Machine Learning and Perception required.
Proven ability to develop new research ideas as demonstrated by a strong publication record and early developments to the level of a working system prototype.
Strong theoretical and practical background in machine learning and computer vision required.
Hands-on coding skills and ability to quickly prototype in C++ is a must. Further experience in scripting languages such as Python is a plus.
Strong skills and prior experiences in systems integration and solutions design required.
Good knowledge of tools and frameworks for deep learning (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe, MXNet etc.) is required.
Established networks within US academia/research institutions preferred.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in English are required.
Knowledge or previous involvement writing funding proposals for research grants is a plus.
Knowledge of Siemens product portfolio and organization is a plus.
Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on http://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs?view=category&id=33#

About Us

COMMITTED TO IMPROVING THE LIVES OF PATIENTS WORLDWIDE

At Celgene, we seek to deliver truly innovative and life-changing drugs for our patients. Our vision as a company is to build a major global biopharmaceutical corporation while focusing on the discovery, the development, and the commercialization of products for the treatment of cancer and other severe, immune, inflammatory conditions.

"At Celgene, we seek to deliver truly innovative and life-changing drugs for our patients."

Investigational compounds are being studied for patients with incurable hematological and solid tumor cancers, including multiple myeloma, myelodysplastic syndromes, chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma (NHL), triple-negative breast cancer and pancreatic cancer. title: Data Scientist - Machine Vision
description:
Join us in making roads safer by making drivers better!
CMT is seeking outstanding Machine Vision Data Scientists to join us in building technology to reliably collect and manage data from sensors on smartphones and connected devices in vehicles. As a member of our Data Science group, you will help accomplish our mission by designing and building solutions that solve our customers problems. Our company is made up of collaborative, customer-committed, and creative experts that enjoy working in a fast-paced and fun environment. We are looking for high performers to help build global-scale solutions to improve safety in an evolving mobile world.
At CMT, a Machine Vision Data Scientist has the opportunity to use visual data streams to help make users better drivers. We collect dashcam and crash data and extract information from these sources to gain a contextual understanding of the environment drivers are in. Contextual information includes detection of objects (such as vehicles, pedestrians) and their motion relative to the driver, traffic modifiers (such as signals, stop signs, lane lines), driver alertness, etc. These contextual cues are used to estimate driving risk. Models extracting contextual information and estimating driving risk are implemented on low-power mobile devices as well as on high-compute server backends thereby calling for the need for a wide range of modeling skills and techniques.

Qualifications:
PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related technical discipline
3+ years of work experience involving statistical modeling, machine learning theory and software development
Strong programming skills for constructing and understanding data pipelines
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of image segmentation, classification, temporal tracking, attention, alignment techniques.
Experience implementing deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch ) and architectures (CNN, RNN)
Familiarity with popular object detection and classification models
Familiarity with object tracking methods
About Cambridge Mobile Telematics
At Cambridge Mobile Telematics (CMT), our mission is to make the worlds roads safer. We are the global market leader in mobile telematics with customers in over 20 countries serving millions of drivers. Our team uses mobile sensing and IoT devices, machine learning, applied statistics, and behavioral science to solve real-world problems to produce clear and actionable insights for drivers, insurers, and fleets. Founded in 2010 from an MIT research project, we still maintain a startup culture often experimenting and nimbly adjusting to the needs of our customers and the market. We are well-financed thanks to customer revenues and a $500M investment from the SoftBank Vision Fund. Please visit www.cmtelematics.com for more information and follow @cmtelematics on Twitter.

title: Data Scientist
description:
We are hiring a Data Scientist with a technical background who has experience deploying machine learning models into production. If you would like to join a fun, great atmosphere at a startup located in East Austin, then make sure to reach out.

What's the Job?

The Data Scientist on our team will be a technical Data Scientist who will be deploying machine learning models into production and building AI capabilities into our core platform. You will be working with a team that includes a data architect, senior developer, computer vision data scientists, and a data engineer. This is a very technical role, so it would be great if you have a research background or were an engineer that transitioned into being a data scientist.

Our customers include everyone from technology companies building self-driving cars to health-tech companies. Our customers use our platform so they can design workflows and reduce the time humans are needed to enrich the data. Your work will be going to building out our core platform that is helping to speed up the deployment of models.

Salary

• $150,000

• Equity in our startup

• We can offer relocation

Skills

• Experience building machine learning models and deploying them into production

•Experience with Python

• Masters/PhD in a STEM field

Who Are We?

We are a fun startup located in East Austin that is focusing on reducing the time needed for companies to deploy their models into production. At our heart, we are a research and engineering-focused startup that has data science at our core. We work in an agile atmosphere with great work/life balance (everyone leaves by 6 pm.!).

title: Head of Computing
description:
Who we are:

Calico is a research and development company whose mission is to understand the biology of aging and to help people to lead longer and healthier lives. We aim to combine the best biomedical science with cutting edge technology and computing.

Position description:

Biology is rapidly becoming a data science, with an ongoing explosion in the amount and quality of biological and medical data. These data can be transformative to our understanding of biology and disease, but deriving these insights requires a careful and rigorous analysis that often goes considerably beyond existing methods.

Calico is seeking a strong leader in the field of computational science, with rich experience in tackling biological problems, for the role of its head of computing. This role entails leading and building our team of world-class computational scientists, who develop and apply data science approaches to biological data in order to better understand the process of aging and aging-related diseases with the goal of developing of therapeutic interventions. These efforts come through collaborations with our internal experimental teams, external collaborations, as well as projects initiated by the computational team, where the data span multiple organisms (from yeast to human), scales (from molecule to entire organisms), data modalities (from physiology to sequencing to imaging to free text), and time scales (from single time points to continuous time series). You will set the vision and oversee the development of cutting edge computational approaches in the fields of data processing, machine learning, data analysis, and data visualization and exploration, which are required for our mission. In addition, you will lead prioritization of the computational efforts that are required in our company.

Position requirements:
Ph.D. in any these computational fields: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Statistics, Genetics, Computer Science, or Physics, with a deep understanding and passion for biological research.
Minimum of 10 years relevant experience in positions of increasing responsibility, including at least 5 years in a management role, with a track record of building and managing an innovative, high-performance team.
Strong track record of collaboration with diverse biological groups tackling wide range of biological questions.
Deep understanding of the diverse data types used in biological and/or medical research (e.g., gene-expression, genomic sequences, proteomics, imaging, physiological data, etc.), including experience in development and application of a variety of modern analytical approaches in the fields of computer science (e.g., machine-learning with an emphasis on modern neural network architectures) and statistics (e.g., GLMs and Bayesian models).
Proven track record working with, producing and interpreting diverse types of biological and/or medical data on a large scale.
Solid understanding of software dev cycles and processes, cloud architectures and state-of-the-art scalable and distributed systems.
Deep understanding of machine learning techniques including discriminative models, generative models as well as Deep Learning techniques for image and video analysis. Ability to effectively gauge and adapt the use of state-of-the-art techniques to further Calico's cause.
Familiarity with modern ML toolkits such as TensorFlow, Torch, etc.
Demonstrated ability in building effective tools and products, leading the organization toward the broad adoption of these tools, and using the tools to extract impactful insights from biological data.
